4C19EC32A8A843CCBEE51D0263B9745E.description: Represent a probability stated as a fraction or decimal as a percent.

5A768A06367D4CABA8C44B76D3CE4153.description: Represent a probability stated as a percent as a fraction or a decimal.

9C86C9A408FB4EBDBFAC4C0FBA1BACF5.description: Explain how theoretical and experimental probabilities are related and why they cannot be assumed to be equal.

E2FD039426504D47868B98F5B6A4252A.description: Solve a probability problem involving two independent events.

84C557F9FBC84FBAB551CA27A763C856.description: Conduct a probability experiment for an outcome involving two independent events, with and without technology, to compare the experimental probability to the theoretical probability.

A2002C9F56D940B8845EEAB1BC9F51A7.description: Determine the theoretical probability of an outcome involving two independent events.

63E1B06BF9D7489EAE666001833D189E.description: Identify the sample space (all possible outcomes) for each of two independent events using a tree diagram, table, or another graphic organizer.

3BFEC047714547E2B097B16F1EB2CD00.description: Provide an example of two independent events, such as: ? spinning a four section spinner and an eightsided die ? tossing a coin and rolling a twelve-sided die ? tossing two coins ? rolling two dice and explain why they are independent.

12FE0355EA5F459D85C6614386DC2588.description: Explain what a probability tells about the situation to which it refers.

E67E1EDCA29649469002937EAD24E5F1.description: Demonstrate an understanding of theoretical and experimental probabilities for two independent events where the combined sample space has 36 or fewer elements.

E0B578C9714545289536B8C1B515AF85.description: Identify the characteristics of a set of data that make it possible to create a circle graph.

50C25CC7AB2840FC82E12AB4717A4A8D.description: Interpret a circle graph to answer questions.

B4549D3EBF3345B684357CE426DD9A4F.description: Translate percents displayed in a circle graph into quantities to solve a problem.

A8E96B808F04436E9C3739C1FDC77890.description: Find, describe, and compare circle graphs in a variety of print and electronic media such as newspapers, magazines, and the Internet.

275AC291BF404F57BD6946C4DCF21F25.description: Create and label a circle graph, with and without technology, to display a set of data.

970C20AEA9674C26B58F8F360D7ACAB1.description: Identify common attributes of circle graphs, such as: title, label, or legend, the sum of the central angles is 360° and the data is reported as a percent of the total and the sum of the percents is equal to 100%.

161B2920F36D439EABBC988A843C075B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of circle graphs.

30A8316E0519455989F7B878875E49F7.description: Explain why qualitative data, such as colour or favourite activity, cannot be analyzed for all three measures of central tendency

97A356A516F741FDAFD4CCB0A69BEC2A.description: Provide examples of situations in which outliers would and would not be used in reporting the measures of central tendency

41DD7001AA534C0F846790E57274BB88.description: Identify outliers in a set of data and justify whether or not they should be included in the reporting of the measures of central tendency

7F6A53FE49E742F5A1D60754AC39193E.description: Explain the effect of outliers on the measures of central tendency for a data set.

67EA449964F94ADCB9EC852C0AB5F5D7.description: Analyze a set of data to identify any outliers

302A724518104F16978DE0A0D0D4A652.description: Solve a problem involving the measures of central tendency.

94BCCA11FD854070948CB2C84425B41E.description: Provide a context in which the mean, median, or mode is the most appropriate measure of central tendency to use when reporting findings and explain the choice.

E6A77DAC8E0C4DBC8F335F37E2AA1316.description: Determine the range of a set of data.

F6683DE941D84B299AF5D1F808791E06.description: Determine mean, median, and mode for a set of data, and explain why these values may be the same or different.

3699675ADCA94F088DB6133B6DCDB699.description: Concretely represent mean, median, and mode and explain the similarities and differences among them.

96310B5BCF4F4C43901BE479B63B82B2.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the measures of central tendency and range for sets of data

10050F911B93469380121521E7B3175B.description: Statistics and Probability - Goals: Spatial Sense, Number Sense, Logical Thinking, Mathematics as a Human Endeavour

7A0FC210FCCF4491BE46CCA59D3412F8.description: Describe the image resulting from the transformation of a 2-D shape on a Cartesian plane by identifying the coordinates of the vertices of the image

17D921F803C7465093D20DADB0BEB188.description: Describe the positional change of the vertices of a 2- D shape to the corresponding vertices of its image as a result of a transformation or a combination of successive transformations

E68DCC3E59F24FF495266328A577A867.description: Perform a transformation or consecutive transformations on a 2-D shape and identify coordinates of the vertices of the image.

35786F7C95D1451998F8DCF432A3C610.description: Determine the distance between points along horizontal and vertical lines in a Cartesian plane.

865C9AFEE73E41B78B76AFE34ADC49EF.description: Describe the positional change of the vertices of a 2- D shape to the corresponding vertices of its image as a result of a transformation or successive transformations on a Cartesian plane.

ED4E4256CCEC4B01B21666B9D9958659.description: Describe the horizontal and vertical movement required to move from one point to another point on a Cartesian plane.

4517152CEAD140DA826E0A6EF7976D26.description: Identify the coordinates of the vertices of a 2-D shape shown on a Cartesian plane.

5ABB703705F84D3EB2807B2406174BB0.description: Expand and demonstrate an understanding of transformations (translations, rotations, and reflections) of 2-D shapes in all four quadrants of the Cartesian plane.

E0D57B2D565B41698F5506C483FEEB5B.description: Create shapes and designs, and identify the points used to produce the shapes and designs in any quadrant of a Cartesian plane

E6C2D9376A814F0D9CB4E6249A3F72F1.description: Draw shapes and designs, using integral ordered pairs, in a Cartesian plane.

69C3D255BB86487EAB276A1DEE1CA6BA.description: Plot the point corresponding to an ordered pair with integral coordinates on a Cartesian plane with a scale of 1, 2, 5, or 10 on its axes.

9ADE5F1EF14049BC89ADE91AFC1AF1F8.description: Identify the location of a point in any quadrant of a Cartesian plane using an ordered pair with integral coordinates.

6EDBB2251C1A47C2A40AE42BEA3C6421.description: Explain how orientation (the direction in a situation) can influence the labelling of the axes on a Cartesian plane.

77AF30A544474D1EB7D408C75F33B6BF.description: Label the axes of a four quadrant Cartesian plane and identify the origin.

A97B58DCABA641179EC6453FA47FAD1F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the Cartesian plane and ordered pairs with integral coordinates.

CDCC0A1555E04AC7A53C240950C410DE.description: Use geometric constructions to create a design or picture, and identify the constructions present in the design.

700A559D012F4C2CBFC6AB7A67DEF3CA.description: Draw the perpendicular bisector of a line segment using more than one method and verify the construction.

57A1B4850DE1471D893B893C773D663B.description: Draw the bisector of a given angle using more than one method and verify that the resulting angles are equal.

21B51445E28949D0A2139C3DA14FFA4B.description: Draw a line segment parallel to another line segment and explain why they are parallel.

32D331B6C93A48548B33268F8081F714.description: Draw a line segment perpendicular to another line segment and explain why they are perpendicular.

75E52211D1C741779A5F7E6A8786B558.description: Use technology to construct parallel lines, perpendicular lines, angle bisectors, and perpendicular bisectors.

C5D54639F347482081FA245AA2CF81A3.description: Investigate how paper folding can be used to construct parallel lines, perpendicular lines, angle bisectors, and perpendicular bisectors.

8C4D84C6BB12463BBACF83EC3979B049.description: Investigate and explain how paper, pencil, compass, and rulers can be used to construct parallel lines, perpendicular lines, angle bisectors, and perpendicular bisectors

3E865C09B44540668E05B1832071BA39.description: Identify, with justification, line segments on a diagram that are parallel or perpendicular.

EA2B9E473FCD467DAC034BA3E7F4024A.description: Identify and describe examples of parallel line segments, perpendicular line segments, perpendicular bisectors, and angle bisectors in the environment.

F762DBD4472C4ABBB106619F8E1FB7EB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of 2-D relationships involving lines and angles

B99923EFFA034B4C8186DE633DD2D4DD.description: Solve problems involving the area of triangles, parallelograms, or circles.

4A2FC26D331A49E29CBD8478C3E72139.description: Generalize a formula for finding the area of a circle.

58E408D2E8964182B0464D546805EFAB.description: Illustrate and explain how the area of a circle can be approximated by the circumference of the circle times its radius.

08F4C4F86DFF4C4C8A971D1C0C01451D.description: Illustrate and explain how to estimate the area of a circle without the use of a formula.

9E5E362D43F9424EB0B24E68BB105861.description: Generalize, using examples, a formula for determining the area of parallelograms.

D779362D0FB744789D2142F48DE847EA.description: Illustrate and explain how the area of a rectangle can be used to determine the area of a parallelogram.

898D16B8137245149B4EE225DEA3E440.description: Generalize, using examples, a formula for determining the area of triangles.

9554F4A2404C4AF7A2E0FF27CE5FF815.description: Illustrate and explain how the area of a rectangle can be used to determine the area of a triangle.

731A6722674D4E6FAB5A01FB3687F52D.description: Develop and apply formulas for determining the area of: • triangles • parallelograms • circles.

341A663F954C4EB6A12F5C26AA0A8104.description: Draw a circle with a specific radius or diameter with and without a compass.

4951F4D197184ACDA1715B9EC7DBC386.description: Demonstrate that the sum of the central angles of a circle is 360°.

F7142E2D21C045AA8509532B607CCAA8.description: Sort a set of angles as central angles of a circle or not.

691E5878CF81491E9EEFDC3339B739A2.description: Define pi (? ) and explain how it is related to circles.

6B0A2A32549F48839E75C4D981790FD8.description: Generalize, from investigations, the relationship between the circumference and the diameter of a circle

5F93CE7EFD7342A191EE2632BB86563D.description: Illustrate and explain the relationship between a radius and a diameter of a circle.

EE0139271B7F4277ABE568F634E1A9A7.description: Explain (with illustrations) why a specified point and radius length (or diameter length) describes exactly one circle.

6509379598394CFD8C1C49AAD74552DD.description: Answer the question “how many diameters does a circle have and why?”

9708E1DAA384460EAA71E94A3FB91422.description: Answer the question “how many radii does a circle have and why?”

6509CA542BBA43AE94072958CD122DD6.description: Define and illustrate the relationship between the diameter and radius of a circle.

7BA8B55225FE4E159150D1A0238C478A.description: Identify the characteristics of a circle.

55109C602A1D4976B3882A7CFF5630FB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of circles including circumference and central angles.

693C070218D542828611F1EC246639EF.description: Shape and Space - Goals: Spatial Sense, Logical Thinking, Number Sense, Mathematics as a Human Endeavour

41D240B7FC344EF6BC6A2AB40AC513F1.description: Verify a solution to a problem involving a linear equation of the form x + a = b where a and b are integers.

9FF28C89779B42BB97FA6D0AE5EC9C2E.description: Represent a problem with a linear equation of the form x + a = b where a and b are integers and solve the equation using concrete models (e.g., counters, integer tiles) and record the process symbolically

2EFEA25F8A0B41E1B297B63A4C7A8F53.description: Demonstrate an understanding of linear equations of the form x + a = b (where a and b are integers) by modeling problems as a linear equation and solving the problems concretely, pictorially, and symbolically.

5FF0E7A039D14BB682E2888FCCE4797E.description: Solve a problem using a linear equation.

EA71A0B535464812BF309CB2ACCA1124.description: Represent a problem situation using a linear equation

EA17BE559FA146A89A71189125E6F44B.description: Explain what the solution for a linear equation means.

F966D2EE5A33429CB9B74374C35942DE.description: Verify the solution to a linear equation using concrete materials or diagrams.

D7FF8488206748B9BABDE87EA7ACBC6C.description: Draw a representation of the steps used to solve a linear equation.

A0EDD50668FB45BE8EC39897C1315391.description: Represent a problem with a linear equation and solve the equation using concrete models, (e.g., counters, integer tiles) and record the process symbolically.

37F4AEC1B150454682CAD53C03899590.description: Identify and provide an example of a constant term, a numerical coefficient, and a variable in an expression and an equation.

4C64564636D74D0398FF429EB2CFD9A3.description: Solve an equation by applying the preservation of equality

6BF753827DCD4A6FAB20AF0396AB4701.description: Generalize strategies for carrying out operations that involve the use of the preservation of equality.

D207B8E0195241D8B3AFA1829D0690CC.description: Model the preservation of equality for each of the four operations using concrete materials or using pictorial representations, explain the process orally and record it symbolically.

055036756BDB43889E41D3B89B8DBAD6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of oneand two-step linear equations of the form ax/b + c = d (where a, b, c, and d are whole numbers, c < d and b ? 0 ) by modeling the solution of the equations concretely, pictorially, physically, and symbolically and explaining the solution in terms of the preservation of equality

1947AC3497BE415FB3999F30E7A86960.description: Verify a possible solution to a linear equation using substitution and explain the result.

9203EAD3326445928D636C946E467D5D.description: Explain how to evaluate an expression and how that result is different from a solution to an equation.

6D41E5B180E94A0E85DD2AEF90C2D351.description: Provide an example of an expression and an equation, and explain how they are similar and different.

D3D763E0EDF64B54A71FF7E2381BAFF7.description: Explain what a variable is and how it is used in an expression.

A78FA3613A73479FB3A180C3A9EC73A4.description: Demonstrate an understanding of equations and expressions by: • distinguishing between equations and expressions • evaluating expressions • verifying solutions to equations.

D13A8D4220A1420B9328D9434533ADDF.description: Describe a situation which could result in a graph similar to one that is shown.

CBFF9B342C5941A799A9310D2E52A357.description: Match a set of graphs to a set of linear relations and justify the selections made.

3935C447E2A14315A795FF7D8D6A497B.description: Match a set of linear relations to a set of graphs and explain the strategies used.

FD12713D0B9643569F9937D1D3A7D84C.description: Analyze a graph in order to draw a conclusion or solve a problem.

C5D18A7201F3497D8509CD69B8B34873.description: Describe the relationship shown on a graph using everyday language in spoken or written form.

B12937753D0A456F8990C83FB85E0C31.description: Sketch the graph from a table of values created for a linear relation and describe the patterns found in the graph.

7F7F89415B1646B1B5C01F0BE4FF3661.description: Create a table of values using a linear relation and graph the table of values (limited to discrete points).

4D01CF69C3B149EBBB05E7CF217C1189.description: Create a table of values for a linear relation by evaluating the relation for different variable values.

FE692AD5F4CA433F9785871C2CC3D713.description: Identify assumptions made when writing a linear relation for a pattern.

12D4CF91E1C64D4192CC5C9CA88B80D9.description: Identify a pattern from the environment that is linear in nature and write a linear relation to describe the pattern

6DAF6829182F403F9391B716A3B9DE1A.description: Provide a context for a linear relation.

9FDD0E54D1DE4B0493A6D8078F768888.description: Analyse whether an oral or written pattern is linear in nature.

768642D518274737A3E6FB03ADAE8703.description: Represent a relationship found within an oral or written pattern using a linear relation

B671BD0038EC466599AA7B862DB761DE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships between oral and written patterns, graphs and linear relations.

191BA721E55447D79F60F37DC1E6979B.description: Patterns and Relationships - Goals: Number Sense, Spatial Sense, Logical Thinking, Mathematics as a Human Endeavour

42697CF1D236451393422AD095AB4354.description: Solve problems involving the addition and subtraction of integers.

6909DA3541B44361BCC5CBBF49D7F690.description: Investigate patterns in adding and subtracting integers to generalize personal strategies for adding and subtracting integers.

4683211BEBD74E2CB3D5DBB8E8117A64.description: Subtract two integers using concrete materials or pictorial representations and record the process symbolically.

2FDE605EFEAB4768A88A4E83D0635790.description: Add two integers using concrete materials or pictorial representations and record the process symbolically

4A8F1B90581942CCA57A984778497235.description: Illustrate, using a number line, the results of adding or subtracting negative and positive integers.

7CA3B1939E7845B3AA0EDB822652E342.description: Explain, using concrete materials such as integer tiles and diagrams, that the sum of opposite integers is zero (e.g., a move in one direction followed by an equivalent move in the opposite direction results in no net change in position).

3C848F43C0DD436EA501EFC6CE1E7560.description: Represent opposite integers concretely, pictorially, and symbolically and explain why they are called opposite integers.

168C2C803F714063BACC1EB0F6445BEB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of addition and subtraction of integers, concretely, pictorially, and symbolically

E6A04E40E0A44E33BBD7BA3D677C08F6.description: Explain how the sum or difference of positive fractions and/or mixed numbers can be represented symbolically in different ways.

EB3CE94A428947D1BDD065D8BFB9A903.description: Solve a problem involving the addition or subtraction of positive fractions or mixed numbers.

5B05F04A49424BA4A0925F2152143055.description: Generalize and explain personal strategies for determining the sum or difference of positive fractions and/or mixed numbers.

98044C2B34F14691AF9CED17C17C4823.description: Simplify a positive fraction or mixed number by identifying and dividing off the common factor between the numerator and denominator.

A6171D0B7D2B461D8B31576EDFD59D45.description: Determine the sum or difference of two positive fractions or mixed numbers with unlike denominators and explain the strategy used.

92C98D92F99847D9A792596DE0CC9889.description: Explain how a common denominator can help when adding fractions and/or mixed numbers.

D5E9135B57714E6EB22AEC5FEA4B66A0.description: Explain how common denominators for fractions and/or mixed numbers and factors are related.

EF8B18D11AD447029AE140A4021A934A.description: Determine the sum or difference of two positive fractions or mixed numbers with like denominators and explain the strategy used.

7208AE566B3943E0951D5BED656C0B97.description: Model addition and subtraction of positive fractions and/or mixed numbers using concrete or visual representations, and record the process used symbolically

00F55778115E46CFAFED8959F7BCEE5E.description: Estimate the sum or difference of positive fractions and/or mixed numbers and explain the reasoning.

B1ECF199518949608110C0095B32D191.description: Develop and demonstrate an understanding of adding and subtracting positive fractions and mixed numbers, with like and unlike denominators, concretely, pictorially, and symbolically (limited to positive sums and differences).

79C3822E198847F5BE719D71CA7D28A7.description: Make and justify decisions, or suggest courses of action based upon known percents for the situation.

5FCBE9CCA129425DAD0217D9EAABB167.description: Explain the meaning of a percent given in a particular context.

EE107B8AA101442F84F5BF6D0224BCC1.description: Determine the answer to a percent problem where the answer requires rounding and explain why an approximate answer is needed, e.g., total cost including taxes.

7E340B8AB8404019A35E350B7732E2EE.description: Solve a problem that involves finding percents of a value.

EADD554BEB5149829227F0F3CD110FA3.description: Solve a problem that involves finding a percent.

325B194BA1DC4787AE82DC4EC6F3218F.description: Express a percent as a decimal or fraction

3E04CB6CC3114CD782CB22A827AD0D28.description: Create a representation (concrete, pictorial, physical or oral) of a fractional percent between 1% and 100%.

4782F0D46C4C432E94171D120A203F27.description: Expand and demonstrate an understanding of percent to include fractional percents between 1% and 100%.

BD54794B71D14443BABDCE28C3873FC2.description: Order the numbers in a set of numbers by using benchmarks on a number line such as 0, ½ , and 1.

B8A324ABE7B84507BB03BF441F284904.description: Identify incorrectly placed numbers within an ordered sequence or shown on a number line.

DE203E47B325429EA34D54369073EFA2.description: Identify, with justification, a number that would be between two given numbers (decimal, fraction, and/or whole numbers) in an ordered sequence or shown on a number line

FB75155984A44B9C8853F030B0F210E9.description: Order a set of numbers containing decimals, fractions, and/or whole numbers in ascending or descending orders and justify the order determined.

10A0299654B344D0A0159DE3C895B150.description: Provide an example where the decimal representation of a fraction is an approximation of its exact value

301389BBFA5B401894BA73AC047DB416.description: Explain the relationship between fractions, decimals, and division.

313356A7BB2B45338F4D08737E6357AE.description: Express a terminating decimal as a fraction.

80A9BCE9A7E94C5E8F95C012FCCF4407.description: Express a repeating decimal as a fraction.

C47C8494B6A7439FABEC85AEA1392753.description: Express a fraction as a terminating or repeating decimal.

32C10DFDCCB94EF08E7FE3378112A83A.description: Explain and demonstrate how any terminating decimal can also be written as a repeating decimal.

BDA00528403448E5B09C4B4EF5DF82E8.description: Sort a set of fractions into repeating or terminating decimals.

2D573BFE78B643A7A586A42BCE86653D.description: Match a set of fractions to their decimal representations.

EAAD950DE178495184BAFD226D4CECD0.description: Predict the decimal representation of a fraction based upon patterns and justify the reasoning (e.g., knowing the decimal equivalent of 1/8 and 2/8, predict and verify the decimal representation of 7/8).

DF9C65754E8048E4AA6F2F810122A1A5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships between positive decimals, positive fractions (including mixed numbers, proper fractions and improper fractions), and whole numbers.

9036A237D908400089A6925633C05CFA.description: Explain by using examples why it is important to follow a specific order of operations when calculating with decimals and/or whole numbers

596C32FF06B246F283AB84E9385E6B42.description: Solve a problem that involves operations on decimals (limited to thousandths) taking into consideration the order of operations.

26B97AC0F2CD4F86A93E52568A3F4761.description: Check the reasonableness of solutions using estimation

039E1CF057DB4055B01E6607CA3F0C4F.description: Solve a problem involving the multiplication or division of decimal numbers with more than a 2-digit multiplier or 1-digit divisor (whole number or decimal), with the use of technology.

2B44305DE33F4DDCA77E3FB63AB17F67.description: Solve a problem involving the multiplication or division of decimal numbers with 2-digit multipliers or 1-digit divisors (whole numbers or decimals) without the use of technology.

8668E829034E4F059E58475977A3706A.description: Solve a problem involving the addition, or subtraction, of two or more decimal numbers.

DD9AC4B3A18A4213BA4274ECC64040B7.description: Provide a justification for the placement of a decimal in a quotient (e.g., for 51.50 m ÷ 2.1, think 50 m ÷ 2 so the quotient is approximately 25 m; thus, the final answer will be in the tens). (Note: If the divisor has more than one digit, students should be allowed to use technology to determine the final answer.)

84FB74C698B14EDF9D1DA9CB391F4189.description: Provide a justification for the placement of a decimal in a product (e.g., for $12.33 × 2.4, think $12 × 2, so the product is greater than $24; thus, the decimal in the final product would be placed so that the answer is in the tens).

E2E0A4D31331443FB20BCA70D897593B.description: Provide a justification for the placement of a decimal in a sum or difference of decimals up to thousandths (e.g., for 4.5 + 0.73 + 256.458, think 4 + 256 so the sum is greater than 260; thus, the decimal will be placed so that the sum is in the hundreds).

E5DACBD45E6548E18C50F7BE0B973A42.description: Expand and demonstrate understanding of the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of decimals to greater numbers of decimal places, and the order of operations.

01CCACE4A9304B43A62A6868013FA5B6.description: Explain (by generalizing patterns, analogies, and mathematical reasoning) why division of non-zero quantities by zero is not defined.

99EF648353F7498A81B951934922B9FE.description: Explain the result of dividing a quantity of zero by a non-zero quantity.

96334091B7BD45FCAE07DE315D447F88.description: Determine or validate the factors of a number by applying strategies for divisibility.

0664A56A63E046319E45B0797705D2B5.description: Apply strategies for determining divisibility to sort a set of numbers in Venn or Carroll diagrams.

066819200D7F47EB8F67DD26AA872B87.description: Investigate division by 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, or 10 and generalize strategies for determining divisibility by those numbers.

D891B2A9515242DDB5B54ED236142DAC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of division through the development and application of divisibility strategies for 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, and 10, and through an analysis of division involving zero.

E035F2877CE24EAA80530DF0F46AE4D5.description: Number - Goals: Number Sense, Spatial Sense, Logical Thinking, Mathematics as a Human Endeavour
